alert.note: Alert for DeKalb (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 25 at 1:45AM CDT until March 25 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN DEKALB COUNTY... At 144 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Trenton to 6 miles east of Ider to near Henagar, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Henagar, Ider, Valley Head, Hammondville, Mentone and Sulpher Springs. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for northeastern Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
